name: Le Meridien Pyramids Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: The Le Meridien pyramids is an ok hotel, but its exterior look, interiors and especially elevators show that it has been quite some time since this hotel was built/renovated.
reviews.title: Nice views to pyramids, but in the middle of nowhere

likes.disliked: — pool & bar closes at 6pm, small pool in general, location next to a superbusy roundabout

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel is the view you have from the pool area to the Pyramids of Giza. However, due to the same reason, location, you also have to recognize that the hotel is right next to a very, very busy traffic circle, with a constant stream of cars honking and beeping.
reviews.title: brilliant holiday

reviews.text: The hotel's staff was very friendly and polite, except in the Lebanese/Egyptian restaurant - the service there was exceptionally rude.
reviews.title: It is what it is.

likes.liked: — the food and the comfort of the rooms
likes.disliked: — For lack of a better way to describe it, I guess I would say the atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the services offered by the hotel, hmm - pool and outside bar closes at 6pm (?? WHY). Hotel has a few choices of food, but apart from this one has to walk on the very busy street a few hundred yards in order to find any other restaurants - and then the choice is quite limited.
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was full of older tourists and its general atmosphere is perhaps best suited for 50+ travellers. The location near Giza's pyramids is both a blessing and curse; nothing else is nearby, and make no mistake, the pyramids are not reacheable by foot!
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at Le Meridien Pyramids at the start of our 2 week trip round Egypt. I booked a Royal Club room with a Pyramid view and we had no real complaints with the hotel.
reviews.title: Good base to explore Cairo!

reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel it was very late and we were allocated a club room with a pyramid view as requested. the room was nice. Nothing special but comfortable and clean. I immediately noticed that we didn't have a balcony just a huge window. I rang down to reception to see if there was any possiblity of moving to a room with a balcony and they were very helpful and said that they were fully booked that night but we could move first thing in the morning! They sent someone up to our room in the morning and we moved with no problem.
reviews.title: below par

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second room was much better. The room was identical but this time had a good sized balcony with a direct view of the pyramids and the swimming pool! I think this was the best view we could have had so i was very pleased!
reviews.title: Le Meridien was everything we needed

likes.liked: — The whole ambience of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to the flight times and our late arrival we only had 2 days there and were determined to make the most of it. We hardly spent any time in the hotel. As we had booked our holiday through Kuoni there was a rep in the hotel to assist us and to book excursions. We booked the excursions through Kuoni as we thought it would be easier although I'm sure we could have got them cheaper through the hotel. We did a half day trip to the Egyptain Museum which was really good! Lots of things to see and a very informative guide. It was very busy and VERY hot inside so if you are thinking of going take lots of water. Camera's are not allowed inside the museum.
reviews.title: Watch for the surcharge - great hotel

likes.disliked: — The surcharge for service - levied after we'd tipped throughout the stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our second day we went on an organized tour to the pyramids. After reading reviews on TA I decided against walking to the pyramids by ourselves so again we booked the trip with Kuoni. This was excellent. and we had the same guide who was very informative again. We went to the pyramids and had the option to go inside (which we didn't do!) and they took us to a panoramic view of all 3 pyramids so we could take photo's. We also visited the sphinx and travelled out of Cairo to visit Memphis (the old captial city of egypt) and the stepped Pyramid at Saqqara! All provided great photo oppertunities and I would highly recommend going to see them.
reviews.title: Amazing views at the Meridien Pyramids Hotel Giza Egypt

reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a multi centre package tour of Egypt.
reviews.title: More for business clients
Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: We paid extra for Pyramid view rooms, which could be seen clearly but directly opposite a busy roundabout which spoilt it somewhat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a short stay but we were glad as we felt out of place here as tourists. I would say that the hotel is geared more towards the business client.
reviews.title: Not 5 star

reviews.text: We visited the pool area when we first arrived and struggled getting a sunbed. Unfortunately work was being carried out which reduced the space available.
reviews.title: Great Pool, upgrade to President's Club

reviews.text: I would also say that the pictures of the pool area with the pyramids in the distance are taken at a very questionnable angle!
reviews.title: Not 5 star by western standards

likes.disliked: — Poor idea of what contitutes good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent. Seeing the pyramids from the pool area is awe inspiring. The hotel is really clean and the staff more than friendly. Nice main restaurant which offers a la carte and buffet. The pool area is lovely although it is beside a construction site at the moment. Not really a problem but can be some noise if they are working. Room was clean and roomy and had no problems.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: hello ,le merdian pyramids is one of the most clean hotels in cairo . it was nice but not merdian.staff were helpful except one or two were rude.the breakfast strats from 3-11 am ,so many choices.but i asked for a coffee, the cups and pot were so dirty.
reviews.title: good hotel but not merdian

likes.disliked: — dirty cold coffee,taxi drivers ,in royal club rooms (leaking minibar)imagen

reviews.text: there are so many shops in the hotel ,atm as well.the swimming pool is not that good but you can see the pyramids while swiming,the mini bar was leaking,but the beds wow very comfortable (the best thing in the hotel) .i asked them for a taxi to take to the airport they said take from outside .taxi drivers were dishonest ,always higher price for me , when they know my dilect ,(saudi) .they ask for 50 us dollars for 10 mintues dist.so you should arrange your tours with ur tarvel agency ,everything . coz i paid 900pounds for a horse tour to see the pyramids .while 100 is too much as so many egyptian friends told me.everyone want tips encluding policemen even in the egy muesm and tips for doing nothing , i think tunisia ,dubai ,jordan and lebanon are better (i mean in arab countries) coz my vacation in egypt was the worst . everything was so dirty .they drive crazy ,so merdian was good hotel but not more than good.
reviews.title: great hote lwith view

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights. Front desk were friendly yet professional. Rooms very nice. Clean and comfortable. If you want a view of the Great Pyramid ask for room 156. I flipped out when I walked in to my room! Balcony, too. Room service very efficient. Included breakfast very nice including egg station. Loved it!
reviews.title: Very good location near the Giza Pyramids

likes.disliked: — Noisy location next to busy street and constant honking horns.

reviews.text: Very short taxi ride to the north entrance to the Giza Plateau area from this hotel or a long walk (if you want to dodge the cray Cairo traffic).
reviews.title: The saving grace of our trip to Egypt!

description: Located less than 1 Kilometer from the Great Pyramids of Giza, Sole survivors of the seven wonders of the World & Only 20 minutes from the City Center,this majestic resort brings you the World right at the Heart of Cairo.
